situation.title: Information on the comprehensive testing by antigen tests
situation.meta_description: Comprehensive testing will take place starting on 18th December 2020 and ending on 15th January 2021. However, it will not be mandatory.

content.processed:
Carrying out surface testing by antigen tests

Comprehensive testing will take place starting on 16th December 2020 and ending on 15th January 2021. However, it will not be mandatory.

The course of surface testing by antigen tests

Testing will take place in the “Network of antigen sampling centres- AOC” in the already operating network of sampling points.

All persons who have public health insurance in the Czech Republic can participate.

Fire and rescue services and the Czech Army will help strengthen the capacities. There will also be a reservation system where citizens can book a date and see the occupancy of individual consumption points. This system will be connected to e-Request (eŽádanka). But you do not need it in advance. On the contrary, you fill in your data in the system, give Informed Consent (due to the processing of personal data) and the system will generate an eRequest for you.

Please note that in order to use the antigene testing point at your practice you find using our map, you have to be registered at that practice, since the practitioners/specialists involved haven't (yet) decided to make their practices/testing points accessible for unregistered patients the list of public sampling points is available at the MZCR website. You can find the same list on the Institute of Health Information and Statistics website, where you can also view the capacity of the Covid-19 testing points. In addition, Prague has its own portal, where you can book an appointment.

From December 17th you can also book your appointment on the phone line 1221. It is available on weekdays from 8 am to 7 pm and on weekends from 9 am to 4.30 pm. Hearing-impaired persons or foreigners who prefer a written form of communication can use the option of a transcribed call.

From January 1, 2021, all health service providers performing antigen testing are obliged to immediately report information on each POC antigen test result electronically to the Infectious Disease Information System (IDIS).

questions_answers.question: I am an practitioner/dentist etc. for adults or kids and teenagers and would like to performing antigen testing for my patients
questions_answers.value:
You will most likely test your patients, however registered providers of the health services in the system of sampling points may decide to test individuals apart from regular patients in compliance with the reimbursement mechanism of insurance companies - performance 99948. 
If you are willing to become a part of this system, all necessary information can be found at the websites of the initiative Doctors Helping Czechia. (https://www.lekaripomahajicesku.cz/). If you will not find any particular information, write an email to dispecinkCRT@mzcr.cz phone number: 973 292 070, where they will provide you every necessary information. Prepare your identification number (IČO), office address and the email.
You have to fulfil following criteria: 
- contractor of health services 
- opening hours at least 3 days a week, 4 hours per day. 
- presence of a medical staff that conducts a collection of biological samples. 
-provider has a AOC well marked and has designated a safe corridor for patients coming for a testing and physical examination. 
-  AOC will have a separate workplace (spatially or timely) for testing and communication of the result. 
-Equipped with PC with internet connection. 
- All required safety measures for PCR testing will be abided. 
- The test has to be taken with small time loss between taking biological material and by its own test. 
- A connection on the electronic tools of Smart Quarantine under management of MZ ČR (ISIN) and fulfilling all required and united reports, must be observed.
Anigene testing will be conducted  in accordance with the algorithms issued by MZDR. Reimbursement of VZP will also include the price of the POC antigen test.
You may find an instruction video on the MZČR YouTube channel (www.youtube.com/watch?v=RhX-AwbV2NQ). 
From January 1, 2021, you will be required to report electronically to the Infectious Disease Information System (IDIS) for each POC antigen test result immediately.

questions_answers.question: Can I have my child tested as part of a comprehensive antigen test?
questions_answers.value: Yes. Kids can be tested in the presence of the legal guardian.
